author: thechekov
post_text: November 23, 2015 at 7:39 PM#1Hi,i wonder if there is the possibility to create a macro  which copies selected cues of a sequence to another sequence.maybe like this:copy cue 0.5 thru 0.7 of sequence 1 to selected sequenceany ideas?Chris

posts.author: thechekov
posts.post_text: November 23, 2015 at 7:39 PM#1Hi,i wonder if there is the possibility to create a macro  which copies selected cues of a sequence to another sequence.maybe like this:copy cue 0.5 thru 0.7 of sequence 1 to selected sequenceany ideas?Chris

posts.author: Duplicate dherderich
posts.post_text: November 25, 2015 at 12:15 PM#2Copy Sequence 1 Cue 0.5 Thru 0.7 At Cue X.You have to specify a target cue of the selected sequence.with at Cue X, the selected sequence will be addressed.

posts.author: alenokia
posts.post_text: December 9, 2015 at 4:07 PM#3catch for seq n° with LUA of  exec $"SELECTEDEXEC"put seq n° in a uservar such as $selectseqthen..copy cue $"SELECTEDEXECCUE" seq $selectseq at cue X seq YLUA:http://ma-share.net/forum/read.php?14,47165,47169#msg-47169

title: copy selected cues of a sequence to a selected sequence
